column1: source,"target","similarity","setnence_num_target","target_sent","source_sent";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Caesar_JC",0.138909216655067,8,"What sayst thou to me now?","A soothsayer bids you beware the ides of March.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Caesar_JC",0.160998603583602,7,"Let me see his face.","A soothsayer bids you beware the ides of March.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Caesar_JC",0.253465039264919,41,"That is enough to satisfy the Senate.","But, alas, Caesar must bleed for it.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Caesar_JC",0.255127293979589,35,"Cannot is false, and that I dare not, falser.","Then, lest he may, prevent.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Caesar_JC",0.272066536128441,30,"We are two lions littered in one day, And I the elder and more terrible.","Let's carve him as a dish fit for the gods, Not hew him as a carcass fit for hounds.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Caesar_JC",0.28299413042468,46,"And this way have you well expounded it.","And so good morrow to you every one.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Caesar_JC",0.285203903151137,48,"I am ashamed I did yield to them.","This shall make Our purpose necessary and not envious;" Which so appearing to the common eyes

#Brutus_JC,"#Caesar_JC",0.286566123374085,38,"Have I in conquest stretched mine arm so far, To be afeard to tell graybeards the truth?","Such an exploit have I in hand, Ligarius, Had you a healthful ear to hear of it.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Caesar_JC",0.288875680864596,18,"Nor heaven nor Earth have been at peace tonight.","We all stand up against the spirit of Caesar, And in the spirit of men there is no blood.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Caesar_JC",0.313532608715466,17,"Come on my right hand, for this ear is deaf, And tell me truly what thou think'st of him.","Into what dangers would you lead me, Cassius, That you would have me seek into myself For that which is not in me?";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Casca_JC",0.265989447078465,50,"Here, as I point my sword, the sun arises, Which is a great way growing on the south, Weighing the youthful season of the year.","But 'tis a common proof That lowliness is young ambition's ladder, Whereto the climber-upward turns his face;" But
column2: when he once attains the upmost round
column3: He then unto the ladder turns his back
column5: scorning the base degrees By which he did ascend.""";

column1: #Brutus_JC,"#Casca_JC",0.27207083549667,51,"Some two months hence, up higher toward the north He first presents his fire, and the high east Stands, as the Capitol, directly here.","What said he when he came unto himself?";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Casca_JC",0.272847900480062,36,"When these prodigies Do so conjointly meet, let not men say "These are their reasons, they are natural," For I believe they are portentous things Unto the climate that they point upon.","Let me not hinder, Cassius, your desires.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Casca_JC",0.276695548674799,26,"There was more foolery yet, if I could remember it.","How I have thought of this, and of these times, I shall recount hereafter.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Casca_JC",0.290619490797915,13,"And for mine own part, I durst not laugh for fear of opening my lips and receiving the bad air.","If I have veiled my look, I turn the trouble of my countenance Merely upon myself.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Casca_JC",0.291452013416539,49,"You shall confess that you are both deceived.","But let not therefore my good friends be grieved (Among which number, Cassius, be you one) Nor construe any further my neglect Than that poor Brutus, with himself at war, Forgets the shows of love to other men.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Casca_JC",0.2915890841561,34,"And there were drawn Upon a heap a hundred ghastly women, Transformed with their fear, who swore they saw Men all in fire walk up and down the streets.","If I have veiled my look, I turn the trouble of my countenance Merely upon myself.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Casca_JC",0.29344582701659,39,"Who ever knew the heavens menace so?","'Tis very like;" he hath the falling sickness.""";

#Brutus_JC,"#Casca_JC",0.295175626064244,44,"So can I. So every bondman in his own hand bears The power to cancel his captivity.","How I have thought of this, and of these times, I shall recount hereafter.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Casca_JC",0.295468408497889,53,"Indeed, he is not fit.","It must be by his death.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Portia_JC",0.216028636076832,18,"If this were true, then should I know this secret.","It must be by his death.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Portia_JC",0.267151345245418,22,"Tell me your counsels;" I will not disclose 'em.""
column2: Such instigations have been often dropped Where I have took them up.""";

column1: #Brutus_JC,"#Portia_JC",0.279417068383898,34,"I heard a bustling rumor like a fray, And the wind brings it from the Capitol.","But, alas, Caesar must bleed for it.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Portia_JC",0.287451596529248,20,"I grant I am a woman, but withal A woman well-reputed, Cato's daughter.","You are my true and honorable wife, As dear to me as are the ruddy drops That visit my sad heart.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Portia_JC",0.292043199376305,23,"I have made strong proof of my constancy, Giving myself a voluntary wound Here, in the thigh.","I am not well in health, and that is all.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Portia_JC",0.293257004913108,41,"Sure the boy heard me.","-  I would it were my fault to sleep so soundly.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Portia_JC",0.299596320568978,3,"I urged you further;" then you scratched your head And too impatiently stamped with your foot.""
column4: redress!"" Am I entreated To speak and strike?""";

column1: #Brutus_JC,"#Portia_JC",0.308879464613291,30,"How hard it is for women to keep counsel!","If not the face of men, The sufferance of our souls, the time's abuse -  If these be motives weak, break off betimes, And every man hence to his idle bed.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Portia_JC",0.327051670559341,21,"Think you I am no stronger than my sex, Being so fathered and so husbanded?","Vexed I am Of late with passions of some difference, Conceptions only proper to myself, Which give some soil, perhaps, to my behaviors.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Portia_JC",0.327727681700944,16,"Dwell I but in the suburbs Of your good pleasure?","But wherefore do you hold me here so long?";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Antony_JC",0.262736257496242,11,"I doubt not of your wisdom.","Thy master is a wise and valiant Roman.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Antony_JC",0.326075424983695,9,"I do beseech you, if you bear me hard, Now, whilst your purpled hands do reek and smoke, Fulfill your pleasure.","Fates, we will know your pleasures.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Antony_JC",0.335199612072655,17,"My credit now stands on such slippery ground That one of two bad ways you must conceit me, Either a coward or a flatterer.","How I have thought of this, and of these times, I shall recount hereafter.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Antony_JC",0.349570341051759,29,"I do desire no more.","Let me not hinder, Cassius, your desires.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Antony_JC",0.37053535076749,6,"Are all thy conquests, glories, triumphs, spoils Shrunk to this little measure?","Thy master is a wise and valiant Roman.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Antony_JC",0.388383683873825,37,"Passion, I see, is catching, for mine eyes, Seeing those beads of sorrow stand in thine, Began to water.","All my engagements I will construe to thee, All the charactery of my sad brows.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Antony_JC",0.388536387386085,22,"Here wast thou bayed, brave hart, Here didst thou fall, and here thy hunters stand Signed in thy spoil and crimsoned in thy Lethe.","Swear priests and cowards and men cautelous, Old feeble carrions, and such suffering souls That welcome wrongs; unto bad causes swear Such creatures as men doubt;" but do not stain The even virtue of our enterprise
column2: Nor th' insuppressive mettle of our spirits
column3: To think that or our cause or our performance Did need an oath
column4: when every drop of blood That every Roman bears
column6: Is guilty of a several bastardy If he do break the smallest particle Of any promise that hath passed from him."""

column1: #Brutus_JC,"#Antony_JC",0.40467074154797,40,"Hie hence and tell him so.","I know that we shall have him well to friend.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Antony_JC",0.410104924767655,20,"- in the presence of thy corpse?","O, then, by day Where wilt thou find a cavern dark enough To mask thy monstrous visage?";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Antony_JC",0.418977678181123,24,"How like a deer strucken by many princes Dost thou here lie!","Swear priests and cowards and men cautelous, Old feeble carrions, and such suffering souls That welcome wrongs; unto bad causes swear Such creatures as men doubt;" but do not stain The even virtue of our enterprise
column2: Nor th' insuppressive mettle of our spirits
column3: To think that or our cause or our performance Did need an oath
column4: when every drop of blood That every Roman bears
column6: Is guilty of a several bastardy If he do break the smallest particle Of any promise that hath passed from him."""

column1: #Brutus_JC,"#Cassius_JC",0.174645567337178,5,"You bear too stubborn and too strange a hand Over your friend that loves you.","Let me not hinder, Cassius, your desires.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Cassius_JC",0.216613427610803,60,"Those that have known the Earth so full of faults.","What is it that you would impart to me?";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Cassius_JC",0.226741532758862,21,"The torrent roared, and we did buffet it With lusty sinews, throwing it aside And stemming it with hearts of controversy.","A soothsayer bids you beware the ides of March.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Cassius_JC",0.228770708364243,37,"When went there by an age, since the great flood, But it was famed with more than with one man?","But let not therefore my good friends be grieved (Among which number, Cassius, be you one) Nor construe any further my neglect Than that poor Brutus, with himself at war, Forgets the shows of love to other men.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Cassius_JC",0.232292709912132,1,"Fellow, come from the throng.","A soothsayer bids you beware the ides of March.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Cassius_JC",0.235960942966117,27,"I did hear him groan.","But let not therefore my good friends be grieved (Among which number, Cassius, be you one) Nor construe any further my neglect Than that poor Brutus, with himself at war, Forgets the shows of love to other men.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Cassius_JC",0.243893360208512,106,"The clock hath stricken three.","But look you, Cassius, The angry spot doth glow on Caesar's brow, And all the rest look like a chidden train.";;

#Brutus_JC,"#Cassius_JC",0.262812888772504,24,"He had a fever when he was in Spain, And when the fit was on him, I did mark How he did shake.","I do lack some part Of that quick spirit that is in Antony.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Cassius_JC",0.263719609005867,101,"And let us swear our resolution.","How I have thought of this, and of these times, I shall recount hereafter.";;
#Brutus_JC,"#Cassius_JC",0.271350023210736,66,"Let it be who it is.","Let me not hinder, Cassius, your desires.";;
